title: How to Make Steamed Pork Buns

steps.headline: Begin by preparing the dough.
steps.description: Dissolve the yeast in lukewarm water. Add 1 cup of flour. Mix thoroughly. Cover with cloth. Let rise 1 hour, until bubbles appear.

steps.headline: Add sugar and vegetable oil to 1/2 cup boiling water.
steps.description: Stir well. Cool until lukewarm. Pour into yeast mixture. Add 3 1/2 cups flour.

steps.headline: Knead dough on lightly floured board until smooth.
steps.description: Put into extra large, greased bowl in a warm place. Cover with damp cloth. Let rise until doubled in size, about 2 hours.

steps.headline: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in wok.
steps.description: Stir fry scallion and garlic for 30 seconds. Add pork. Stir fry 1 minute. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar.

steps.headline: Pour in dissolved cornstarch.
steps.description: Stir fry quickly until pork is glazed. transfer everything to a large bowl and cool.

steps.headline: On a floured board, knead dough 1 minute and roll into one long  roll 2 inches (5.1 cm) in diameter.
Flatten each piece a bit with the palm of your hand and roll with rolling pin into 3 inch (7.6 cm) rounds.
Place 2 tablespoons of filling in center of each round, and gather the dough up around the filling by pleating along the edges.
Bring the pleats up and twist securely and firmly.
Place each bun on a 2 inch (5.1 cm) square of aluminum foil, on the steamer tray.
steps.description: Cover with a towel. Let rise 1 hour, until dough springs back when touched with finger. Remove towel.

steps.headline: Steam over briskly boiling water for about 10 minutes.

text: Begin by preparing the dough. Dissolve the yeast in lukewarm water. Add 1 cup of flour. Mix thoroughly. Cover with cloth. Let rise 1 hour, until bubbles appear. Add sugar and vegetable oil to 1/2 cup boiling water. Stir well. Cool until lukewarm. Pour into yeast mixture. Add 3 1/2 cups flour. Knead dough on lightly floured board until smooth. Put into extra large, greased bowl in a warm place. Cover with damp cloth. Let rise until doubled in size, about 2 hours. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in wok. Stir fry scallion and garlic for 30 seconds. Add pork. Stir fry 1 minute. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar. Pour in dissolved cornstarch. Stir fry quickly until pork is glazed. transfer everything to a large bowl and cool. On a floured board, knead dough 1 minute and roll into one long  roll 2 inches (5.1 cm) in diameter. Slice the roll into 1" rounds. Flatten each piece a bit with the palm of your hand and roll with rolling pin into 3 inch (7.6 cm) rounds.  Place 2 tablespoons of filling in center of each round, and gather the dough up around the filling by pleating along the edges.  Bring the pleats up and twist securely and firmly.  Place each bun on a 2 inch (5.1 cm) square of aluminum foil, on the steamer tray. Cover with a towel. Let rise 1 hour, until dough springs back when touched with finger. Remove towel. Steam over briskly boiling water for about 10 minutes.  Serve and enjoy!
